alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Martin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 8:07PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Martin, southeastern Johnson and north central Floyd Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 806 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms centered over Nero, or near Van Lear, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Breif torrential downpours, wind gusts up to 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Odds around 810 PM EDT. Buffalo around 815 PM EDT. Meally, Perston Estates, Woodland Estates and Thealka around 820 PM EDT. Thelma around 825 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Paintsville, Bobbs, Williamsport, Tutor Key, Wells Chapel, Boons Camp, Whitehouse, Offutt, River, Chestnut, Davisport, Pevier, Davella, Delong and Debord. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 3 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 4. Kentucky Highway 3 in Johnson County Kentucky Highway 3 in Martin County between mile markers 1 and 8. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 19 and 21. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 0 and 3, and near mile marker 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
